headline: CNN News Central
subHeadline: Biden Marks One Year Since Signing Gun Safety Law; Biden Touts Gun Law Achievements One Year Later. Aired 3-3:30p ET

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: If that's the truth, now, don't make a lie --As that scene in the John Wayne movie, "Don't make me a dog-faced, lying pony soldier." All right, well, I tell you what - here's what I'm going to do. I'm going to ask the White House photographer to come up. And what I'm going to do is I'm going to stand - I can't - I usually shake everybody's hand. But I'm going to stand in front of each section. No, I really mean it. And then - and if you can see the camera, they can see you. And it's the least consequential part of this whole meeting for you, I promise. All right?

utterances.speaker: BORIS SANCHEZ, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: We've been listening to President Biden speaking at the Safer Communities Summit in West Hartford, Connecticut. The president marking one year since passing the Bipartisan Safer Communities Act, the most sweeping piece of gun control legislation passed in the United States and some 30 years of the President saying it is a first step "we are not finished calling for more, a new legislative ban on assault weapons, a ban on high capacity magazines and more expensive red flag laws."We want to go now to CNN's Priscilla Alvarez who is there for us. And Priscilla, I found it very notable the President putting out a call not only to Congress, but also to voters. The president saying that this Congress needs to act and if they refuse to we "need a new Congress."
